intro: Puya mirabilis, commonly known as the Queen of the Andes, is a striking plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy inflorescence that can reach up to three meters in height. The plant features broad, sword-shaped leaves that form a rosette, creating a water-holding structure at the center. Its flowers are typically bright red or orange, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Puya mirabilis is known for its long flowering period and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
